page.title: 19Ningwood and Shalfleet Manor
page.content: The{Manor of Ningwood}was recorded in the Domesday Book and was valued at 7 pounds. Liet.Colonel and Mrs.Shapland bought the manor in 1975. The{gardens are open to the public from time to time. In planning the garden great attention has been given to{colour. } There is a lot of{yellow}at the front of the house.At the back there is a garden of{white}flowering plants. {Shalfleet Manor}is right in the village. The name is Saxon and refers to the shallow creek. At one time the nearness of the village to the Newtown River and harbour made it a busy place. The manor is a very pretty one and is set among pleasant gardens.There is a glimpse of the{rose walk}and the {lavender hedges}from the road. There is a swimming pool at the back.
